function: Allows users to register new products by submitting their details through a form.
static_description: A centered card with a white background containing labeled input fields for Product ID, Name, Description, Manufacturer, Manufacture Date, and Batch Number. A firebrick-colored 'Register Product' button is located below the inputs.

interaction_and_states.description: Clicking the 'Register Product' button submits the form data to the backend API endpoint /api/products/register. Displays success or error message based on response.

resource_dependency.trackingPathVisualizationComponent: Timeline visualization showing nodes representing locations/events

function: Displays the chronological movement and handling history of a product across the supply chain.
static_description: A vertical timeline view with circular nodes connected by lines. Each node shows location name, timestamp, event type, and handler. Background color is misty rose; components are firebrick.

interaction_and_states.description: Entering a Product ID into the search field filters and loads the corresponding tracking path dynamically from the API endpoint /api/products/{productId}/track.

function: Enables querying of the current status and whereabouts of a specific product.
static_description: Top section contains a search bar with placeholder 'Enter Product ID'. Below it, a panel displays status info such as 'In Transit', last updated time, and current location in firebrick text over misty rose background.

interaction_and_states.description: Clicking the 'Search' button or pressing Enter after entering a Product ID fetches and displays the latest status from the API endpoint /api/products/{productId}/status.

function: Verifies whether a product is genuine by checking its ID against the database records.
static_description: A simple interface with an input box for Product ID and a large firebrick 'Verify' button. Verification result appears below with either a green checkmark or red cross icon followed by status text.

interaction_and_states.description: Clicking the 'Verify' button sends the Product ID to the backend API endpoint /api/products/{productId}/verify and displays the authenticity result.

function: Presents aggregated statistical views of supply chain activity including total products, tracking events, and verification results.
static_description: Dashboard grid layout featuring three panels: Total Products (number), Tracking Events Over Time (line chart), and Verification Success Rate (pie chart). All charts use firebrick accents on a misty rose background.

interaction_and_states.description: Upon loading, the dashboard automatically fetches analytics data from multiple API endpoints and renders visualizations using Chart.js.

function: Manages user login sessions and controls access to protected features based on roles.
static_description: Login page with email/password fields and a firebrick 'Sign In' button. After successful login, navigation menu becomes accessible with links to all main functionalities.

interaction_and_states.description: Clicking 'Sign In' authenticates credentials via POST to /auth/login. Upon success, stores JWT token and redirects to home/dashboard.
If no active session exists or token expires, redirects unauthenticated users back to the login screen when trying to access restricted pages.

resource_dependency.auditLogTableSchema: [{timestamp: datetime, userId: string, action: string, productId: string}]

function: Maintains a record of all actions taken within the system related to products for compliance and troubleshooting purposes.
static_description: Tabular view listing audit entries sorted by timestamp descending. Columns include Timestamp, User, Action Type, and associated Product ID. Table header and rows styled with firebrick highlights on misty rose.

interaction_and_states.description: The audit log table auto-fetches logs from /api/admin/audit-logs upon accessing the admin section and updates periodically every minute.

function: Ensures optimal display and usability of the entire application on various devices including smartphones, tablets, and desktops.
static_description: All major layouts utilize responsive grids that stack vertically on small screens. Navigation transforms into a collapsible hamburger menu. Forms and buttons scale appropriately for touch interaction.

interaction_and_states.description: Layout adjusts fluidly according to viewport size using media queries. Mobile-specific styles activate under 768px width breakpoint.

resource_dependency.dataUpdateHooks: Frontend listens to WebSocket messages to update relevant UI parts instantly without manual refresh.

function: Keeps frontend data synchronized with backend changes in real-time without requiring manual page reloads.
static_description: UI elements like tracking timelines and dashboards show live updates whenever backend data changes occur. Visual indicator shows real-time sync status.

interaction_and_states.description: Receiving a WebSocket message triggers automatic re-rendering of affected components like updating a tracking event or refreshing dashboard stats immediately.

resource_dependency.databaseConnectionConfig: Uses env vars: DB_HOST=localhost, DB_PORT=5432, DB_USERNAME=myappuser, DB_PASSWORD=myapppassword, DB_NAME=myapp

function: Establishes persistent storage layer for managing all product lifecycle data and metadata using PostgreSQL.
static_description: PostgreSQL database initialized with tables for storing product definitions, event histories, verification attempts, user accounts, and system audits. Connection secured using provided credentials.

function: Provides RESTful interfaces for frontend applications to perform CRUD and business logic operations securely.
static_description: REST-compliant API routes exposed under /api prefix. Endpoints support standard HTTP verbs matching their intended actions (e.g., POST for registering products). Authenticated routes require valid tokens.

resource_dependency.packageJsonScripts: {"install:all": "concurrently \"npm install\" \"cd client && npm install\"", "dev": "concurrently \"npm run server\" \"cd client && npm run dev\""}
resource_dependency.projectStructureGuide: Root directory includes server code and client subfolder housing frontend app built with React/Vue/etc.

function: Sets up unified development workflow enabling installation and simultaneous execution of frontend and backend services.
static_description: Root-level package.json defines two custom scripts: install:all runs dependency installations for both sides, and dev launches both servers concurrently using concurrently package.
